sentence.Network_en: "You haven't got the right attitude," he said sulkily.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怄气道：“你态度不端正。”

sentence.Network_en: He spoke rather sulkily, feeling himself stalemated.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说话时绷紧了脸, 觉得无计可施.

sentence.Network_en: Winston looked at the thing sulkily and without interest.
sentence.Network_cn: 温斯顿不高兴地看一眼,毫无兴趣.

list.abs: " The album , " said Edward sulkily .“画册。”爱德华说道。

entry.tran: 面有愠色的;生闷气的;闷闷不乐的
entry.def: Someone who is sulky is sulking or is unwilling to enjoy themselves.

example.ex: I was quite sulky, so I didn't take part in much.
example.tran: 我很烦，所以没有积极参与。

sentences.sentence: "`What else could I do?' said Graham sulkily"

auth_sentence.content: Then he sulkily retreated to his hotel suite and wrote Dancing in the Dark.
